containerApps.description: An Azure Container Apps extension for Visual Studio Code.
containerApps.enableOutputTimestamps: Prepends each line displayed in the output channel with a timestamp.
containerApps.showDraftCommandDeployPopu: Show an informational deploy pop-up message whenever a draft command is run.
containerApps.deleteConfirmation: The behavior to use when confirming delete of a Container Apps environment.
containerApps.deleteConfirmation.EnterNa: Prompts with an input box where you enter the Container Apps environment name to delete.
containerApps.deleteConfirmation.ClickBu: Prompts with a warning dialog where you click a button to delete.
containerApps.openAcrBuildLogs: Open Azure Container Registry Build Logs
containerApps.deployWorkspaceProject.con: When deploying from a local workspace project, the name of the target container app to deploy to.
When deploying from a local workspace project, the name of the target container app's resource group.
When deploying from a local workspace project, the name of the Azure Container Registry to use for storing and building images.
containerApps.walkthrough.gettingStarted: Getting Started with Azure Container Apps
Learn to deploy a containerized application to Azure Container Apps using a sample GitHub repository.
containerApps.walkthrough.clearWorkspace:
Before proceeding with the demo, an empty VS Code workspace is required.
Use the button provided below and press enter until all active workspaces have been removed.
[Remove Folders from Workspace](command:containerApps.walkthrough.clearWorkspace)
containerApps.walkthrough.cloneProject.d:
Start from an empty project and use the button provided below. This will clone the sample project from GitHub onto your local workspace.
Enter the provided table values when prompted by Visual Studio Code.
[Git: Clone](command:containerApps.walkthrough.cloneProject)
containerApps.walkthrough.azureSignIn.de:
Sign in is required before you can access Azure services. Use the button provided below to sign in.
A window will open up in your browser. Follow the prompts to authenticate.
Once signed in, return to Visual Studio Code.
[Azure: Sign In](command:containerApps.walkthrough.azureSignIn)
containerApps.walkthrough.deployWorkspac:
Use the button provided below to create the container app resources necessary to host the application.
Enter the provided table values when prompted by Visual Studio Code.
[Deploy Project from Workspace](command:containerApps.walkthrough.deployWorkspaceProject)
containerApps.walkthrough.review.title: Review
containerApps.walkthrough.review.descrip:
Take this time to review what we've done so far using the provided table.
When you're done reviewing, you can use the button provided below to delete any created resources during this session.
[Azure: Delete Resource Group](command:containerApps.walkthrough.deployWorkspaceProject)
